p: Based on the interests expressed in this study, greater communication by local governments with Black and Hispanic constituents about climate change processes and mitigation is recommended. Emergency and risk communication should also better target Hispanic community members during acute events, as Hispanic respondents to this survey appeared to have more limited access to both emergency alerts and health care services for health problems due to extreme weather and environmental hazards. Such outreach should consider linguistic, cultural, or dissemination barriers that residents encounter during such events.
